alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 7:44PM CDT until August 25 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Phillips and Smith. Portions of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Franklin, Furnas and Harlan. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including city streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have already fallen, or will yet fall within the next 1 to 2 hours within much, but not all, of the Advisory area. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Walnut Creek, Medicine Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, Prairie Dog Creek, East Big Creek, Plum Creek, Turkey Creek, East Plum Creek, Big Cottonwood Creek, West Beaver Creek, West Cedar Creek, West Big Creek, West Middle Cedar Creek, Sappa Creek, West Plum Creek, Plotner Creek, Bow Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Phillipsburg, Alma, Franklin, Kensington, Agra, Kirwin, Republican City, Long Island, Prairie View, Naponee, Bloomington, Glade, Athol, Speed, Cedar, Harlan County Dam and Woodruff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
